Context: The "Letâ€™s Get Started" Primer for Anti-Racism is a tool developed by George Brown College to support the community in engaging with anti-racism practices. The primer uses five steps: self-reflect, educate, rethink, identify, and engage. It includes an Anti-Racism Self-Assessment, opportunities for reflection on selected media, and resources such as films and books to develop an understanding of racism. The goal is to challenge personal perspectives, identify ways racism can be produced through systems, and provide tools for engagement in anti-racism practice. Contact information: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca. Additional resources include a land acknowledgment and updates on college news and events through signing up. The information contained in the website is subject to change without notice.
